qas.question: Another name for errors in programs are called what?
Bugs are usually the fault of whom or what?

answers.text: programmer error or an oversight made in the program's design

context: Errors in computer programs are called <a0_0>"bugs<a0_0/>". They may be benign and not affect the usefulness of the program, or have only subtle effects. But in some cases, they may cause the program or the entire system to "hang", becoming unresponsive to input such as mouse clicks or keystrokes, to completely fail, or to crash. Otherwise benign bugs may sometimes be harnessed for malicious intent by an unscrupulous user writing an exploit, code designed to take advantage of a bug and disrupt a computer's proper execution. Bugs are usually not the fault of the computer. Since computers merely execute the instructions they are given, bugs are nearly always the result of <a1_0>programmer error or an oversight made in the program's design<a1_0/>.
